articleContent.title: Chord: 13th in C# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Chord: 13th in C# (Shape: C)

## Description
The 13th chord in C# (also known as C#13) is a rich and complex chord consisting of several notes. It is built upon a C# root note and includes the following intervals: major third (E#), perfect fifth (G#), minor seventh (B), major ninth (D#), perfect eleventh (F#), and major thirteenth (A#).

## Notes and Intervals
- C# (root)
- E# (major third)
- G# (perfect fifth)
- B (minor seventh)
- D# (major ninth)
- F# (perfect eleventh)
- A# (major thirteenth)

## Genre and Flavor
The C#13 chord is commonly found in jazz, R&B, and soul music. Its rich and colorful sound adds depth and sophistication to harmonic progressions. This chord is often used in smooth and laid-back genres where extended and complex harmonies are favored. It adds a sense of tension and release, creating a lush and captivating musical flavor.

## Songs
Three songs that feature the C#13 chord:
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis** - This iconic jazz tune features the C#13 chord in various harmonic passages, showcasing its versatility in a modal jazz context.
2. **"Lovely Day" by Bill Withers** - In this soul classic, the C#13 chord is used to create a warm and soulful atmosphere, complementing the smooth vocal melodies.
3. **"Cantaloupe Island" by Herbie Hancock** - A jazz-funk staple, this composition prominently utilizes the C#13 chord to establish a groovy and infectious harmonic foundation.
